Something about this place makes me wish I was in love.  I guess I feel a void whenever I'm at home.  It makes me want to fall back into something that I know isn't for me.  The phrase "in love with being in love" comes to mind.  

I'm thankful for Freed-Hardeman.  I really hope I don't screw myself over and have to come home.  Like always I've had plenty of time to evaluate things and over-analyze.  I'm not going to say that I'm completely content with not having a boyfriend, but I don't think about it nearly as much when I'm at school.  I let other things take that place... and that's the way it should always be.  

I've been pretty level-headed about relationship business while at school.  I'm not looking for Mr. Right Now anymore, although I'm sure I could have one.  I do like someone.. I'm not head-over-heels for them though.  Which is good, because it's not healthy to fall for someone who hasn't fallen for you.  He's become one of my best friends, and I'm certainly not going to push for something that may not be there on his end.  

I've set standards for my future spouse, yet none of them are physical standards since I don't feel I have the right to do so.  If they DO happen to be taller and I DO happen to fit in their arms.. major bonus points. Haha.  Yeah, I have no clue where any of that came from.  Disregard if you feel the need.

SO, pretty sure I have the exact same new years resolutions as I have the past 5ish years.  Also, pretty sad that I haven't really followed them through yet.  Maybe it's stupid to even make a resolution, seeing that I haven't ever kept one.  We shall see.  I do know that if I don't keep atleast one of them, I'll be saying hello to Winston-Salem again.

I've been home for about a week and 2 days.  I'm going back to Huntsville tomorrow evening.  Normally I'd be excited about going back.  I'm just disappointed that I can't spend more time with mom and a few other people.  There are also some people who I haven't hung out with at all... so I'm bummed about that.  Anywho, I will spend the next 2 weeks in Huntsville.  Being bored because 1) I'm broke, as usual and 2) pretty sure most of my friends have jobs and won't be free during the daytime.  I reckon I'll spend a few days taking down all of Grandma's Christmas decorations.  Then I'll clean the house.  That'll keep me busy for a while, I'm sure.

Good news.  Alex Vizcaino is coming to Freed this semester.  I'm super excited.  He's a sweetheart!  I'm glad we'll get to be closer friends.  It'll also be nice to have a piece of Warners with me.  (and rides home! haha)

Christmas was a good one.  I got a digital camera, a straightener, and a phone for my room from mom and dad.  Timmy got me this eye shadow set that has like 96 different shades, or something crazy like that. And Grammie and Granddaddy got me a copier/scanner/printer.  :)  And for Christmas dinner we had prime rib and the greatest cheesecake ev-er.  Yes, I'm a fat kid, and I am NOT looking forward to Gano. Haha.

I think I'm all typed-out.  I hope all of you had a happy Christmas, and I wish all of you a wonderful New Year.

Jennifer, Alex, and Jess, I had so much fun with y'all this week.  I'm going to miss you like woah.

Last week was midterms, therefore I had a ton of studying and homework to do.  I was so stressed out by Friday afternoon that I couldn't see straight.. which makes no sense because by that time all the tests and such were over.  Friday afternoon I was certain that I had failed my bible test and Abbey had decided at the last minute to go on the retreat with Vitarelli and I had a million pound package to pick up.  I was just gonna leave it there this weekend but mom called and was flipping out because she paid extra so i'd have it this weekend.  I ended up going to get it.  I got sort of depressed because everyone was either going home or going on the retreat. Then I perked up a little because I remembered Lauren was gonna be here too.  And I needed sleep like woah.  So Friday night we walked to the chinese place to eat dinner.. then we went to gano and used one of our meals just to get desert.  Heck yes.  We just hung out in my room all night.  Then we went to devo. 

Saturday I slept til 11.  I really didn't do much Saturday but it was relaxing.. and that's what I needed.  I showered and met Mary Anne's parents and talked to them for a few.  Ate leftover chinese with Lauren then went to Walmart with Justin...  Came back and washed clothes... Ate dinner with James and Lauren.... washed more clothes... went to devo.. and this is where my weekend turned from good to WONDERFUL.

First I have to tell the story of Garrett.  SO I know that Freed-Hardeman isn't exactly a huge school.. but I'm dead serious when I say that ever since the first day of school... I'd see Garrett everywhere.  I have no classes with this kid, and me and my friends are hardly consistant in times in which we go eat and such.  Everywhere I went, there he was... and none of this was planned on either side I'm sure.  So, I was really intrigued by this guy simply because I saw him all the time.  A few weeks into school there was a talent show.. he sang and played the piano.  He has the most gorgeous voice. AHH.  Anyway, a few weeks after that we had homecoming elections and he got elected to be a representative.  A day or two after that I found him on facebook.  I didn't friend him or anything I just sent him a message saying he did a good job at the talent show and congtats on homecoming.  SO, he friended me.  This was about 3 weeks ago I guess.  I still continued to see him all the time... THEN last Thursday when I was walking to class he caught up with me and introduced himself and asked if I was Ashley because he recognized my facebook picture.  So we talked for a few minutes...  I didn't really talk to him again all last week.. we waved at eachother a few times..  OK.  BACK TO LAST NIGHT'S DEVO.  He came up to me and just started talking.  And we talked for a good thirty minutes.  Then he asked me and Lauren if we wanted to go to church with him this morning.  So we did.  And he is wonderful.  And I barely know him.. but so far it's been creepy how everything just fits together.  This morning when I was getting ready, I was listening to Gavin Degraw.  I get into his car and he's listening to the same thing.  He played his favorite song on the album, which also happens to be one of my favorites.  I put my glasses on during church this morning and he looked over at me and said he liked them. Haha.  So, I really don't know this kid.  He seems so sweet and nice though.  I really hope I get the chance to get to know him better.  One of our mutual friends, Heather, has been talking to both of us.  And he's told her that I'm really sweet and he'd like to get to know me... which is what I've been telling her.  We're both on the same page and that's a good thing.

This weekend has rocked my socks.

I feel like I have one of those middle school crushes... but I don't care.  haha

She mentioned my name and he said I was really sweet.  *swoon*
